title: How was the unification of Italy achieved? - Quora

response.answer_text: By military. It’s technically a militar conquest of the Kindom of Piedmont, annexing all northern dukedoms, then sending an unofficial army (lead by Garibaldi) to fight the Kingdom of Naples and Sicily. The idea was that if they did not succeed, they where just “a group of fanatics with strange ideas no one was knowing about”. (In modern terminology: terrorists) But they succeeded and unified the kingdoms. After that they crunched the Papal state into the Vatican.  The rest happened after WW1 as a consequence of the defeat of the Austro-Hungarian empire. After WW2 Istria was given to Yugoslavia, later divided between Slovenia and Croatia, based on pre-existing borders.
